result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan Troy Thomas Phalen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jordan Troy Thomas Phalen in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Jordan Troy Thomas Phalen in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:35 AM. 16CM182 - plead to couns #1, #3 and #4 as alleged, remaining counts to be DRI, #1 - $500 fine plus C&S, #3 - 45 days in FC jail, #4 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions to be stated shortly; on 17CM57 - plead to counts #1, #4, #5 and #7 as alleged, on counts #1 and #5 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years - #1 - 60 days conditional jail, court costs on each count, #4 - $100 fine plus C&S, and on count #7 - $100.00 fine plus C&S, remaining counts to be DRI; condition of probation to include: AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns or similar class B establishments, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 200 hours of community service as deemed appropriate b P&P; on 16CM68 - dismiss and read in all counts. Joy and Phalen understand. Court - 16CM182 - dismisses and reads in counts #2, #5 and #6; 17CM57 - dismisses and reads in counts #2, #3, #6, #8 and #9; 16CM68 - dismiss and reads in all three counts. Phalen pleads NC to counts #1, #3 and #4 on 16CM182 as alleged, pleads NC to counts #1, #4, #5 and #7 on 17CM57 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - have complied with victim notification requirements with no response. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Phalen withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 16CM182 - count #1 - $500.00 fine plus costs and surcharges - 60 DTP/CO, count #3 - 45 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - no credit, cost - 60 DTP/CO, on count #4 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of - consecutive to jail time on 16CM182 (Count #3): AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, no consumption or possession of alcohol, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 200 hours of community service as deemed appropriate by P&P (total), obtain GED within the first year of probation; on 17CM57 - on counts #1 and #5 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years - concurrent to each other and to probation on 16CM182 with same conditions as on 16CM182 with no additional community service, costs - 60 DTP/CO, on count #1 - 60 days of conditional jail in the FC jail - huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.09(7m) - no credit - consecutive to jail time on 16CM182, costs - 60 DTP/CO; on counts #4 and $7 - $100.00 fine plus costs on each count - 60 DTP/CO, submit DNA sample, right to appeal, adjourned.
notice of electronic filing
Status conference on June 28, 2017 at 10:15 am.
arrested Forest County
Notice of hearing

Attorney Jeffery Joy in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:23 PM. Joy has filed a motion to withdraw as counsel and argues motion. Court grants motion to withdraw and counsel is to send a letter to his last known address advising him of that, warrant stays active.
Motion hearing on March 1, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
to Witdraw as Attorney of Record

Attorney Jeffery Joy in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:44 AM. Called 16CM68 and 16CM182. State - are currntly set for a JT tomorrow on these matters. Joy makes a motion to withdraw for stated reasons, defendant was aware of this court date as talked to him last night around 7:30 PM. State - makes statement in regards to defendant's whereabouts and not showing for court today. Court leaving JT on the calendar. Court forfeits any bond posted and issues bench warrant, body or $3000.00 on each case and considers State's offer withdrawn at this point. Joy is willing to stay on the case to resolve it but will not wait too long to do that.
JTP
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 9, 2017 at 10:30 am.
to appear & act
Jury trial on February 10, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jeffery Joy in court. Phalen does not appear. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 16CM68 and 16CM182. Called 1:24 PM. Joy indicates matter is not resolved, Joy has authorization to appear. Court does not see Authorization to Appear in file. Court - Forfeit bond on each case, issue warrant body or $500 on each case. Joy objects and argues it was sent to JA yesterday. Off record to check for Authorizaiton. Back on the record 1:34 PM. Court now has autorization to appear that was faxed yesterday and sets for trial.  Jury trial scheduled for February 10, 2017 at 08:30 am.
JTP
December 14, 2016 Final pre-trial.
State's
Final pre-trial on December 14, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
No consumption of alcohol. No entry into any bars or taverns.
No consumption of alcohol. No entry into any bars or taverns.
Final pre-trial on November 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jordan Troy Thomas Phalen not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:31 AM. Called 16CM182 and 16CM68. Warrant will continue on 16CM68. State asks for warrant on 16CM182. Court issues warrant for non appearance, body or $500. Re-called 2:28 PM. Defendant Jordan Troy Thomas Phalen now appears via video from FC jail with attorney Jeffery Joy appearing by phone.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called cases 16CM68 and 16CM182 from this morning. On 16CM182 - Here for inital appearance. Phalen has complaint, court advises of charges and penalties. Phalen understands charges. Joy waives further reading and enters NG plea on all counts. On 16CM68 - Court advises of charges and penalties. Joy waives further reading and enters NG pleas to all counts. State - does not object to signature bond on each case being re-instated. Court re-instates signature bonds on each case with original conditions.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on October 12, 2016 at 09:00 am.
arrested FOSO

Defendant Jordan Troy Thomas Phalen not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:10 AM. State  - S&C mailed to last known address and another address and neither have been returned. State requests forfeiture of any bond posted, bench warrant body or $500.00. Court issues bench warrant, body or $500.00.
